definitions.definition: One who has high and controlling authority in sacred things; the chief of a sacred order.
A title of bishops in their role as ordinaries ( arbiters of canon law ) over their respective dioceses .

main_definition: ( religion ) One who has high and controlling authority in sacred things; the chief of a sacred order.
secondary_definitions: ( Eastern Orthodoxy ) A title of bishops in their role as ordinaries ( arbiters of canon law ) over their respective dioceses .
